title: United Raises Outlook on Robust Demand
text:
United’s net profit in the third quarter rose to over $1 billion.

United Airlines Holdings Inc. UAL 1.05% reported third-quarter profit that outstripped expectations, and it raised its earnings estimates for the year as a surge in booking demand helped offset the challenges of the grounding of Boeing Co. ’s 737 MAX.

Chicago-based United said on Tuesday that it expects to report 2019 profit of $11.25 to $12.25 a share, compared with the range of $10.50 to $12 it had previously anticipated. The No. 2 U.S. carrier by traffic said it is targeting earnings of $11 to $13 a share in 2020.

United’s shares were up 2% in after-hours trading, after closing up 1% at $87.88 during the regular session.

description: United Airlines profit outstripped expectations as the company raised its earnings estimates for the year amid a surge in bookings.
